did.abstract: The collection contains the personal and professional papers of Florence Whitney Fosdick, Elinor Fosdick Downs, and Dorothy Emerson Fosdick. There is a small amount of genealogical and biographical information concerning a number of other Fosdick family members, notably Harry E. Fosdick. The Elinor F. Downs materials contain materials about her medical and public health career; her 1961 study of Arab refugees; writings and illustrations for scientific and archaeological studies; and photograph albums and scrapbooks pertaining to her public health, archaeological and adventure travels.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for use without restriction beyond the standard terms and conditions of Smith College Special Collections. Collection has not been fully processed and therefore may be somewhat difficult to use.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Collection was given as a gift to Smith Special Collections by Elinor Fosdick Downs between 1996 and 2006.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Florence Whitney Fosdick: graduated Smith 1900, married Harry Emerson Fosdick 1904. They had two daughters, Elinor and Dorothy. Elinor Fosdick Downs: graduated Smith 1933, Johns Hopkins 1937 (also attended Harvard Medical School and Columbia); Pediatrician, school physician, medical officer for maternal and Child Health Section, World Health Organization, 1941-51; Staff Director, American Public Heath Association, 1958-67, Pediatrician at Babies Hospital, Columbia, 1958-77; Administrator at Columbia School of Public Health, 1974 and various teaching positions at Columbia. Married Mr. Downs. Dorothy Emerson Fosdick: graduated Smith 1934, PhD Columbia; taught sociology and political theory at Smith; 1942-64 worked for State Department, planning, for United Nations, worked with Adlai Stevenson, legal aide to Senator Henry Jackson.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Some Fosdick correspondence in Doty Papers. Harry Emerson Fosdick's papers are located at Union Theological Seminary.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Fosdick Family Papers consist of correspondence, clippings, geneaology, memorabilia, photographs, printed material, scrapbooks, and writings by and about Florence Whitney Fosdick, Elinor Fosdick Downs, and Dorothy Emerson Fosdick. There is a small amount of genealogical and biographical information concerning a number of other Fosdick family members, notably Harry E. Fosdick. The Florence Whitney Fosdick materials consist of correspondence, photos, clippings, etc. The Elinor F. Downs materials consist of a scrapbook and correspondence about her childhood plus materials about her medical and public health career, marriage, and slides, notes and copies of her 1961 study of Arab refugees; autobigraphical essays, writings and illustrations for scientific and archaeological studies, and photograph albums and scrapbooks pertaining to her public health, archaeological and adventure travels are also included. Dorothy Fosdick materials consist of biographical information plus 13 photographs and albums documenting her childhood, family events and celebrations, trips, and professional activities, circa 1915-1990s.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: To the extent that she owns copyright, Downs has assigned the copyright in her works to Smith College; however, copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For instances which may regard materials in the collection not created by Downs, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.
